page.title: 01Afon Dysynni
page.content: Most of the hills north of the Afon Dysynni are covered by heath, moor and grassland. Much of the lower sections have various tree clusters that sweep down to the river plain (conifer and deciduous). The flood plain is enclosed rough grazing land, chiefly used for sheep and cattle. Numerous homestead dot the landscape and small tributary valleys flow into the Dysynni and its offshoot canals. Much of the hills that surround the river plain is composed of steep open u or v shaped valleys The Abertrinant Hills, South of the Pont Y Garth Weir, are the same as the other surrounding hills except for a densely covered confier and deciduos wood at the bottom of te hill, as it reached the valley floor.
